title.narrative: Women's Action for Voice and Empowerment Program

description.narrative: Goal: Women lead transformative, sustainable change towards Gender Equality, enabled by strategic feminist engagement Impact 1: Individual women's leadership influences political, economic and social decisions Outcome 1: Women, including young women, are in influential political, civic and business leadership positions. Intermediate Outcome 1a: Women are supported to achieve and retain elected office Intermediate Outcome 1b: Women Leaders have greater support and opportunities within community, economic and social spheres Output 1.1: Women in politics develop leadership skills and influence Output 1.2: Women have increased skills and confidence to engage in civic, social and economic leadership Output 1.3: Young women have increased skills and confidence to engage in leadership Output 1.4: Women lead responses to violence against women Output 1.5: Men, including young men, are increasinginly engaged in male advocates programme Impact 2: Power holders and institutions are responsive to and accountable for women's rights and status Outcome 2: Individual champions and institutional processes bring increased realisation of women's rights Intermediate Outcome 2a: Normative Frameworks that support women are in place at local, subnational and/or national level Intermediate Outcome 2b: Duty bearers are willing, resourced and supported to implement normative frameworks Output 2.1: Advocacy plan developed and implemented focused on CPP and EVAW which uses targeted channels and platforms to advance women's priorities Output 2.2: Partner monitoring and reporting on government performance against obligations creates accountability push Output 2.3: Duty bearers are have increased knowledge of and willingness to implement policy, budget and legal changes to support women Impact 3: A vital, visible and vocal women's movement aggregates and amplifies women's power and priorities Outcome 3: Autonomous women's organisations, groups, networks and coalitions collaborate on common goals and shared objectives Intermediate Outcome 3a: National and regional women's movements are strengthened Intermediate Outcome 3b: Individual women and women's movements are able to represent issues at strategic national and international forums Output 3.1: Programme provides space and resources to support the formation and development of national and regional women's movements Output 3.2: Individual women's organisations have strengthened capacity to commit and engage Impact 4: Evidence of how change towards gender equality happens informs individuals, institutions and movements Outcome 4: Iterative advocacy and learning is enhanced by inclusive and systematic research collaborations Intermediate Outcome 4a: Evidence is used in programming and linked to advocacy Output 4.1: Research, Evidence and Learning Framework is developed and resourced to generate research and evidence outputs Output 4.2: Research and advocacy networks are developed that reflect diversity and experience

The WAVE program will achieve impact in four nested areas: * Individuals – Developing women leaders and leadership capabilities across generations * Political and Governance Systems – Generating change to inequitable legal, policy and economic frameworks * Women’s Movement and CSO’s – Catalysing collective action and accountability for women’s rights and gender equality * Research, Evidence and Learning – Applying knowledge from women’s voice and lived experiences to advocacy and policy settings
Women, young women, young men, duty bearers, political parties, government officials, women candidates, women parliamentarians

participating-org.narrative: Asisténsia Legál ba Feto no Labarik (ALFeLa)

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 64 Flinders Lane Melbourne, Vic 8009

recipient-country.narrative: % is as at May 2016 with unallocated regional funds likely to impact this percentage
% is as at May 2016 with unallocated regional funds likely to impact this percentage

% is as at May 2016 with unallocated regional funds likely to impact this percentage
% is as at May 2016 with unallocated regional funds likely to impact this percentage

description.narrative: Advocacy plan on CPP and EVAW is developed and implemented; and uses targeted channels/platforms to advance gender equality priorities.
By December 2016, at least 4 Joint Advocacy Plans (JAPs) developed with at least 12 program partners
By December 2020, 70% of actions in each Joint Advocacy Plan (JAPs) is implemented
Duty bearers are have increased knowledge of and willingness to implement policy, budget and legal changes to support women
50% of duty bearers express willingness to support women's agendas

comment.narrative: This indicator has proved too difficult to track as partners cannot complete pre-post testing with duty bearers (too politically sensitive) and also duty bearers change often so tracking their awareness over time is not possible. This indicator will therefore be removed. IWDA plans to collect qualitative data around duty bearer awareness of obligations at end-line.

description.narrative: Knowledge of 90% targeted duty bearers increases

comment.narrative: This indicator has proved too difficult to track as partners cannot complete pre-post testing with duty bearers (too politically sensitive) and also duty bearers change often so tracking their awareness over time is not possible. This indicator will therefore be removed. IWDA plans to collect qualitative data around duty bearer awareness of obligations at end-line.

description.narrative: Individual champions, policy frameworks and institutional mechanisms bring increased realisation of women's rights

By December 2020, 30 actions by government to introduce or enforce laws, policies and other frameworks that are in line with international human rights/women's rights standards (CEDAW, Beijing Platform for action)

comment.narrative: Actions by government to introduce or enforce laws and other frameworks that are in line with international human rights/women's rights

description.narrative: By December 2020, 45 cases of successful advocacy for introduction of or improved impelmementation laws/policies/budgets or programs

comment.narrative: Refers to cases of successful advocacy for introduction or improvement of laws/budgets or programs

description.narrative: By December 2020, 50% of duty bearers targeted report increased awareness of their obligations and responsibilities relating to relevant normative framework (e.g.. domestic violence laws, labour laws, gender based violence action plans, TSM etc.) and/or have changed their position on the issue targetted

comment.narrative: This indicator has proved too difficult to track as partners cannot complete pre-post testing with duty bearers (too politically sensitive) and also duty bearers change often so tracking their awareness over time is not possible.This indicator will therefore be scrapped. IWDA plans to collect qualitative data around duty bearer awareness of obligations at end-line.

description.narrative: Partners and/or IWDA participate in joint dialogue spaces for advocacy, advising, or lobbying government e.g. consultative forums, roundtables etc. to inform policy, legal, budget changes

comment.narrative: Partners and/or IWDA participate in joint dialogue spaces for advocacy

description.narrative: Individual organisations, national and regional women's movements are strengthened and women leaders and movements effectively collaborate in strategic national and international forums.
Partners ability to commit and engage is increased (25% partners to very high, 25% to high, 50% to moderate)

comment.narrative: A percentage score has been attributed to the categories: low (1-25%), moderate (26-50%), high (50-75%) and very high (76-100%). A country average has then been calculated across the partners. In 2016, this was 50%.
A percentage score has been attributed to the categories: low (1-25%), moderate (26-50%), high (50-75%) and very high (76-100%). The target, across all partners, at a country level, is 69%.

Reporting this year shows that 20% of partners assessed their capacity to commit and engage as 'very high', 60% assessed their capacity as 'high', and 20% assessed their capacity as 'moderate'. This represents a program level average, across all partners, of 75%.

description.narrative: By December 2020, 5 new MoUs or ongoing relationships established between 10 women's organisations,

comment.narrative: This refers to the number of new MoUs or ongoing relationships established between women's organisations through the WAVE Program

description.narrative: By December 2020, 8 platforms of action/plans are successfully implemented by the FLOW partners and their networks which are influencing and/or advocating on policy in international and national debates/decisions

comment.narrative: This indicator duplicated information already collected at Output 2.2a and Outcome 2.b. It will therefore be removed.

description.narrative: Individual women's organisations have strengthened capacity to commit and engage
By December 2020, 16 partner organisations demonstrate increased capacity in line with self-identified priorities.

comment.narrative: Number of partner organisations that demonstrate increased capacity in line with self-identified priorities

description.narrative: By December 2020, at least 4 partner organisations have organised rapid response to emergent issues/threats to women's rights
By December 2020, membership organisations increase membership base by 20%
Iterative advocacy and learning is enhanced by inclusive and systematic research collaborations
2 significant multi-actor research projects are designed by the end of Year 2

comment.narrative: Refers to the number of multi-actor research projects that have been designed by the end of Year 2 of the Program

description.narrative: Evidence is generated to alter program planning and implementation (at least 1 per partner)
Partners distributing results of research and evidence to increased number of policy makers and policy maker networks (at least 30 cases)
Men, including young men, are increasing inly engaged in male advocates programme
By 2020, 100 male advocates recruited and trained
By December 2020, 10,000 people reached through efforts of male advocates.
Partner monitoring and reporting on government performance against obligations creates accountability push
By December 2020, FLOW partner organisations have conducted 5 pieces of new research / evidence gathering to support advocacy

comment.narrative: This refers to completed research

description.narrative: By December 2020, FLOW partner organisations have undertaken at least 100 cases of advice, advocacy, lobbying to their government regarding performance against their obligations.

comment.narrative: Cases of advice, advocacy, lobbying to partner's governments regarding performance against their obligations.

description.narrative: Programme provides space and resources to support the formation and development of national and regional women's movements
Programme facilitates 6 learning and sharing connections per year across and within target countries

comment.narrative: Learning and sharing connections across and within target countries

description.narrative: Programme provides resources to 3 national women's movements actions per year, that would otherwise not been possible

comment.narrative: National women's movements actions resourced through the programme

description.narrative: Research and advocacy networks are developed that reflect diversity and experience
100% of agreements successfully include diverse organisations and individuals in design, implementation and analysis of research projects

comment.narrative: Percentage of agreements that include diverse organisations and individuals in design, implementation and analysis of research projects

description.narrative: By December 2020, 4 new multi-actor agreements have been formed to support implementation of RELF, of these 50% are likely to continue beyond programme lifecycle

comment.narrative: Refers to the number of new, multi-actor agreements that have been formed to support implementation of the RELF

description.narrative: Research, Evidence and Learning Framework is developed and resourced to generate research and evidence outputs
By December 2016, WAVE program has developed a RELF to support program monitoring, evaluation, research and learning strategies
By December 2020, FLOW partner organisations have carried out at-least 4 feminist participatory research projects in line with the RELF
Women Leaders have greater support and opportunities within community, economic and social spheres
By December 2020, 60% of women participants report they have the necessary support and opportunities to undertake leadership roles

comment.narrative: Refers to the percentage of women participants who report they have the necessary support and opportunities to undertake leadership roles

description.narrative: By December 2020, an increased proportion of respondents to the public perceptions of women in leadership survey support women's leadership and/or express more gender equitable attitudes

comment.narrative: As we are only undertaking one Perceptions of women as leaders research project in each country (Solomon Islands, Timor Leste and Cambodia) we will not be able to determine whether an increase has occured. Results from the 3 research projects will provide information at the goal level in exploring changes to gender norms (with impact, outcome and outcome information included at Impact 4). This indicator will be removed.

description.narrative: Women and young women have greater opportunities and are supported in achieving and retaining influential and leadership positions in political, social and business spheres.
By December 2020, number of seats held by women in national, subnational and local government increases by 25% across target countries

comment.narrative: % of seats held by women in national, sub national and local government. There was an error in the original baseline calculation. This has been corrected.
Refers to the percentage of seats held by women in national, sub-national and local government

description.narrative: By 2020, 75% of up to 1200 Women involved in the program report improved influence and / or occupy positions of substantive power in local, subnational, and national government and/or civic or private sector positions

comment.narrative: Refers to the percentage of women who report improved influence or occupy positions of substantive power, specifically in the political sphere.

description.narrative: Increase in women willing to consider being a candidate and/or female candidates running and/or margins by which women lose elections are narrower.

comment.narrative: We can only collect data on the number of women who are participating in WAVE programs which is collected in other indicators. There is no other way to gauge general interest. This indicator will therefore be removed.

description.narrative: Women have increased skills and confidence to engage in civic, social and economic leadership
By December 2020, 1,200 women participating in leadership programs assume new leadership roles.
By December 2020, 70% of 12,000 target participants report increased confidence and demonstrate new leadership skills

comment.narrative: This relates to the percentage of target participants who report increased confidence and demonstrate new leadership skills

description.narrative: Women in politics develop leadership skills and influence
# of unsuccessful candidates supported after elections

comment.narrative: Unsuccessful candidates supported after elections

description.narrative: By December 2020, 90% of 1,200 women candidates involved in the program report that they have increased skills, network and supporter base to run for elections at local, national and international.

comment.narrative: Refers to the percentage of women candidates involved in the program who report increased skills, networks and supporter base to run for elections

description.narrative: Women lead responses to violence against women
By December 2020, 7,500 women experiencing violence will have received essential services, such as legal assistance, counselling, and access to safe houses.

comment.narrative: Refers to the number of women experiencing violence who are receiving essential services, such as legal assistance, counselling, and access to safe houses
Refers to the number of partners who have implemented prevention initiatives at the community level

description.narrative: Young women have increased skills and confidence to engage in leadership
70% of young women participants (at least 1,600 participants total at 2020) report increased skills and confidence and willingness to take on leadership roles

comment.narrative: This refers to the percentage of young women participants who report increased skills and confidence and willingness to take on leadership roles

description.narrative: By December 2020, 400 young women participating in leadership programs who assume new leadership roles.

comment.narrative: This refers to the number of young women participating in leadership programs who assume new leadership roles
